title: Travis Head, David Miller, Pat Cummins Not Retained Ahead Of Major League Cricket Season 3 Draft
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) franchises have announced their retained players ahead of the third season's draft, set to take place on February 19. Several star players, including Australia's Travis Head and Pat Cummins, along with South Africa's Kagiso Rabada and David Miller, were not retained, ESPNCricinfo reported. Defending champions Washington Freedom retained 15 players, the most by any team, but let go of Head, their joint-highest run-getter alongside captain Steve Smith with 336 runs each. The franchise also let go of bowlers Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye, who took two and five wickets each last season, as per ESPNCricinfo.

San Francisco Unicorns retained their key players, including explosive openers Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk, but released Cummins (four wickets), Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis (157 runs in nine matches). The Unicorns were runners-up in the 2024 season.

Seattle Orcas retained just seven players, including overseas stars Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton. He was retained despite Klaasen's poor form last season (97 runs in six matches). However, the team released big names like Quinton de Kock (170 runs in seven games), Michael Bracewell, Obed McCoy, and Nandre Burger (four wickets last season).

LA Knight Riders retained three overseas stars--West Indies veterans Sunil Narine (five wickets) and Andre Russell (129 runs, two wickets in six matches), along with Australian pacer Spencer Johnson (nine wickets in six games). Meanwhile, Miller (81 runs in six games), Jason Roy (163 runs in six matches), Shakib Al Hasan (60 runs, one wicket in four games), and Adam Zampa were released.

MI New York, the inaugural champions, retained West Indies legend Kieron Pollard (63 runs, five wickets in five matches), Trent Boult (nine wickets in seven matches), Nicholas Pooran (180 runs in seven matches), and Rashid Khan (162 runs, 10 wickets in seven matches). However, they released Anrich Nortje (one wicket in two matches), Rabada, and power-hitters Tim David (27 runs in three matches) and Dewald Brevis (85 runs in four matches).

Texas Super Kings (TSK) retained captain Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway (420 and 293 runs in eight innings, respectively). They also kept Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis (83 runs, seven wickets in seven matches) and Afghanistan spinner Noor Ahmad. Among the released players were Mitchell Santner (two wickets in two matches), Matheesha Pathirana, Daryl Mitchell, and Naveen-ul-Haq.

Several notable domestic U.S. players were not retained, including Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom).

Retained Players List for MLC 2025:

LA Knight Riders: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine.

MI New York: Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult.

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short.

Advertisement

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton.

Texas Super Kings: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis.

Washington Freedom: Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards.

(Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)

Topics mentioned in this article
summary:
**Retained Players**: Ahead of the third season's draft on February 19, MLC franchises have announced their retained players. Notable retained players include:

* Washington Freedom: 15 players, including captain Steve Smith
* San Francisco Unicorns: Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and others
* LA Knight Riders: Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, and Spencer Johnson
* MI New York: Kieron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan
* Texas Super Kings: Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad

**Released Players**: Several star players were not retained, including:

* Travis Head (Washington Freedom)
* Pat Cummins (San Francisco Unicorns)
* Kagiso Rabada (MI New York)
* David Miller (LA Knight Riders)
* Quinton de Kock (Seattle Orcas)

**Notable Domestic U.S. Players Released**: Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom)

**Full Retained Players List**: The article provides the complete list of retained players for each MLC team, including LA Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

title: Head, Rabada, Miller not retained ahead of MLC 2025 draft
body:
The six Major League Cricket franchises named their retentions ahead of the draft on February 19

ESPNcricinfo staff

15-Feb-2025 • 22 hrs ago

Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada and David Miller were among the big names missing as Major League Cricket franchises named their retentions ahead of the draft for the next season on February 19.

Defending champions Washington Freedom retained 15 players, the most across all teams, but let go of Head, who was their joint-highest scorer last year alongside captain Steven Smith. Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye were the other overseas players released by Freedom.

San Francisco Unicorns, runners-up in 2024, also kept a majority of their core intact, including their hard-hitting opening pair of Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk, but parted ways with Cummins, Matt Henry and Josh Inglis among others.

Seattle Orcas, having retained just seven players - the fewest among the six teams, will go through the biggest squad revamp. They retained just two overseas players - the South African duo of Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton, the latter has had a successful run in international cricket since the last MLC season. Among their seven overseas players released were Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, Obed McCoy and Nandre Burger.

LA Knight Riders will also face a similar challenge in the draft, having retained just three overseas players in Andre Russell, Sunil Narine and Australian left-arm quick Spencer Johnson. Their releases included Miller, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan and Adam Zampa.

MI New York, who won the inaugural MLC title, have retained the services of Kieron Pollard - an MI veteran - along with Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran and Rashid Khan. However, they let go of the South African pace duo of Rabada and Anrich Nortje, as well as Tim David and Dewald Brevis.

Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway are expected to be back at the top of the order for Texas Super Kings in the new season. They have also retained allrounder Marcus Stoinis and Afghan left-arm wristspinner Noor Ahmad. Mitchell Santner, Matheesha Mathirana, Daryl Mitchell and Naveen-ul-Haq are among the releases.

The notable domestic players who have not been retained include MI New York's Steven Taylor, Seattle Orcas' Shehan Jayasuriya and Washington Freedom's Jasdeep Singh.

List of players retained for MLC 2025

LA Knight Riders: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine

MI New York: Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton

Texas Super Kings: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis

Washington Freedom: Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards
summary:
**Retentions Ahead of Draft**

The six MLC franchises have announced their retained players ahead of the draft on February 19. Notable players missing from the retention lists include Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller.

**Team-wise Retention Summary**

* Washington Freedom: Retained 15 players, including captain Steven Smith, but released Travis Head and two other overseas players.
* San Francisco Unicorns: Retained most of their core players, including Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk, but released Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis.
* Seattle Orcas: Retained only seven players, including two overseas players, and will undergo a major squad revamp.
* LA Knight Riders: Retained three overseas players, including Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, and Spencer Johnson, but released David Miller, Jason Roy, and Shakib Al Hasan.
* MI New York: Retained Kieron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan, but released Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Tim David, and Dewald Brevis.
* Texas Super Kings: Retained Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad, but released Mitchell Santner, Matheesha Mathirana, Daryl Mitchell, and Naveen-ul-Haq.

title: Head, Rabada, Miller not retained ahead of MLC 2025 draft
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) teams have announced player retentions ahead of the 2025 draft, with several high-profile players not being retained, including Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller. Defending champions Washington Freedom, who retained 15 players, released Head, their co-leading scorer last season. Other teams like San Francisco Unicorns and Seattle Orcas are also undergoing significant roster changes, with Orcas retaining only seven players, the fewest in the league. The draft is set for February 19 and will see teams aiming for major revamps in their lineups.

By the Numbers

Washington Freedom retained 15 players but released Travis Head, their joint-highest scorer in 2024.

Seattle Orcas retained only 7 players, releasing 7 overseas players including Quinton de Kock and Michael Bracewell.

Yes, But

The lack of retention for key players like Cummins and Rabada raises questions about teams' strategies and the impact of player performance on decisions. While some franchises maintain a strong core, others may struggle to fill the gaps left by released stars, affecting their competitive edge.

State of Play

Major League Cricket franchises are preparing for a steep roster overhaul ahead of the 2025 draft.

Teams are balancing between retaining current core players and optimizing their rosters with new acquisitions.

What's Next

As the draft approaches, teams will look to strategically acquire talented players to fill gaps left by released stars. The upcoming season may see a higher emphasis on emerging domestic and international talent, reshaping team compositions significantly.

Bottom Line

The retention decisions highlight the evolving landscape of Major League Cricket, emphasizing strategic changes that could reshape team dynamics significantly for the 2025 season. Franchises must now tactically navigate the draft to rebuild and strengthen their squads.
summary: The Major League Cricket (MLC) teams have announced player retentions ahead of the 2025 draft, with some high-profile players not being retained, including Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller. Washington Freedom, the defending champions, retained 15 players but released Travis Head, their co-leading scorer last season. Seattle Orcas retained only 7 players, the fewest in the league. The draft is set for February 19, and teams are preparing for a significant roster overhaul. The retention decisions indicate strategic changes that could reshape team dynamics for the 2025 season, with teams needing to tactically navigate the draft to rebuild and strengthen their squads.

title: MLC 2025 Retentions: Stoinis to Maxwell - List of International Retained Players Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

MLC 2025 Retentions: Several big name players were retained as Major League Cricket (MLC) franchises have announced their retention list ahead of the third season's draft, set to take place on February 19.

The six MLC teams - MI New York, Texas Super Kings, Los Angeles Knight Riders, Seattle Orcas, San Francisco Unicorns and Washington Freedom had earlier revealed their domestic players retention with some top names being let go.

Defending champions Washington Freedom made the most retentions overall as they retained 15 players, including six overseas stars, featuring their captain Steve Smith and his Australian compatriots Glenn Maxwell and Jack Edwards as well as a couple of New Zealand and a solitary South Africa star.

Last season's runners up, San Francisco Unicorns retained their key players, including explosive openers Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk as well as Pakistan pacer Haris Rauf, while Seattle Orcas retained just seven players, including two overseas stars Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton of South Africa.

LA Knight Riders retained three overseas stars - West Indies veterans Sunil Narine (five wickets) and Andre Russell (129 runs, two wickets in six matches), along with Australian pacer Spencer Johnson (nine wickets in six games).

MLC Retentions 2025: Netravalkar to Unmukt Chand – List of Domestic Players Retained Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft

MI New York, the inaugural champions, retained West Indies legend Kieron Pollard (63 runs, five wickets in five matches), Trent Boult (nine wickets in seven matches), Nicholas Pooran (180 runs in seven matches), and Rashid Khan (162 runs, 10 wickets in seven matches).

Texas Super Kings (TSK) retained captain Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway (420 and 293 runs in eight innings, respectively). They also kept Australian all-rounder Marcus Stoinis (83 runs, seven wickets in seven matches) and Afghanistan spinner Noor Ahmad.

A total of 23 players were among the international players being retained by the MLC franchise ahead of the player draft. Australia dominate the list with seven retentions followed by four retentions each from South Africa, West Indies and New Zealand. Here is a look at the foreign players retained before the draft:

MLC Retention 2025 - List of International Retained Players Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft

LA Knight Riders 2025 Retained Players: Spencer Johnson (Australia), Andre Russell (West Indies), Sunil Narine (West Indies)

MI New York 2025 Retained Players: Kieron Pollard (West Indies), Nicholas Pooran (West Indies), Rashid Khan (Afghanistan), Trent Boult (New Zealand)

San Francisco Unicorns 2025 Retained Players: Haris Rauf (Pakistan), Finn Allen (New Zealand), Jake Fraser-McGurk (Australia), Matthew Short (Australia)

Seattle Orcas 2025 Retained Players: Heinrich Klaasen (South Africa), Ryan Rickelton (South Africa)

Texas Super Kings 2025 Retained Players: Faf du Plessis (South Africa), Devon Conway (New Zealand), Noor Ahmad (Afghanistan), Marcus Stoinis (Australia)

Washington Freedom 2025 Retained Players: Marco Jansen (South Africa), Glenn Maxwell (Australia), Lockie Ferguson (New Zealand), Rachin Ravindra (New Zealand), Steve Smith (Australia), Jack Edwards (Australia)
summary:
* The six MLC teams have announced their retention lists ahead of the third season's draft on February 19.
* Defending champions Washington Freedom retained the most players, with 15 players including six overseas stars, such as captain Steve Smith and Glenn Maxwell.
* Other teams' retention highlights include:
	+ San Francisco Unicorns: Retained Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, and Haris Rauf.
	+ Seattle Orcas: Retained Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton.
	+ LA Knight Riders: Retained Sunil Narine, Andre Russell, and Spencer Johnson.
	+ MI New York: Retained Kieron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan.
	+ Texas Super Kings: Retained Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad.
* A total of 23 international players were retained, with Australia having the most representations with 7 players, followed by South Africa, West Indies, and New Zealand with 4 players each.

title: MLC 2025 Retention Surprises Fans As Head, Cummins, Rabada, De Kock Axed From The List
body:
Washington Freedom Won MLC In 2024 (Source: @ATLife0/x.com)

Story continues below ADVERTISEMENT

Major League Cricket played a massive role in popularising cricket in the United States. After two successful seasons, the thrilling T20 tournament is all set to come up with yet another edition.

Before the season started, the franchises confirmed their retention list. Big names like Travis Head, Daryl Mitchell, Anrich Nortje, and Pat Cummins were left out, making this bold move the talk of the town.

Pat Cummins Fails To Be Retained

After two successful seasons, Major League Cricket is set to come back with another thrilling season, and the teams have confirmed their retention list. After winning the MLC trophy last year, the Washington Freedom retained almost the core squad of 15 players. But the real shocker came when they released Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye.

Walking in the same way, San Francisco Unicorns released powerhouses like Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis, and that was marked as a bold move by the franchise. Meanwhile, Seattle Orcas took an even riskier approach, releasing stars like Quinton de Kock, Obed McCoy, and Nandre Burger, retaining only seven players in a surprising move.

Miller, Zampa, And Domestic Stars Miss Out On Retention

Before stepping into the upcoming season of MLC, MI New York retained big names but released star bowlers like Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje. Along with them, Tim David and Dewald Brevis failed to find their places on the retention list. Meanwhile, LA Knight Riders shook things up by releasing big names like David Miller, Jason Roy, and Adam Zampa, leaving fans surprised.

Despite holding onto key players like Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad, the Texas Super Kings made surprising cuts, parting ways with stars like Naveen-ul-Haq, Daryl Mitchell, Mitchell Santner, and Matheesha Pathirana. Just not the big names of international cricket, domestic talents like Steven Taylors, Jasdeep Singh, and others failed to secure a spot in franchises' retention list.

Full List Of Retained Players For MLC 2025

Here is the full list of retained players for MLC 2025.

MI New York: Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult

LA Knight Riders: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton.

Washington Freedom: Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short
summary:
**Recent Season Winner**: The Washington Freedom won the MLC trophy in 2024.

**Retention Lists**: Before the upcoming season of MLC, franchises have confirmed their retention lists. Notable players who were not retained include Pat Cummins, Daryl Mitchell, Anrich Nortje, and Kagiso Rabada. Other big names like David Miller, Jason Roy, and Adam Zampa were also released by their respective franchises.

**Franchise-Specific Retention Lists**: 

* Washington Freedom retained 15 players, including Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, and Steven Smith, but released Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye.
* San Francisco Unicorns released Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis.
* Seattle Orcas took a bold approach, releasing Quinton de Kock, Obed McCoy, and Nandre Burger, and retained only seven players.
* MI New York retained big names like Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan, but released Tim David and Dewald Brevis.
* LA Knight Riders retained players like Andre Russell, Sunil Narine, and Spencer Johnson, but released David Miller, Jason Roy, and Adam Zampa.
* Texas Super Kings retained Devon Conway, Marcus Stoinis, and Noor Ahmad, but released Naveen-ul-Haq, Daryl Mitchell, Mitchell Santner, and Matheesha Pathirana.

**Full List of Retained Players**: The article provides the full list of retained players for MLC 2025, divided by franchise.

title: MLC 2025 Retention Snub Explained As Pat Cummins, Travis Head Set To Skip 2025 Season
body:
Pat Cummins and Travis Head [Source: @mufaddal_vohra/X.com]

Story continues below ADVERTISEMENT

The 2025 Major League Cricket (MLC) season faces a star-powered void as Australian stalwarts Pat Cummins and Travis Head confirmed their absence, prioritizing national duties over franchise commitments as they are set to play Australia’s tour of West Indies in late June.

Their exit sparks a reshuffle across franchises, blending strategic retentions and bold releases ahead of the upcoming draft. Though MLC is set to miss most of the international stars due to national commitment, the 2025 edition might see fresh faces emerging.

MLC Franchises Set To Adjust Roster After Star Exit

Despite losing Head, the defending champions, Washington Freedom retained core firepower, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, and Jack Edwards return, alongside Steven Smith, though his availability remains clouded by Australia’s red-ball schedule. The Freedom parted ways with Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye, banking on their depth to chase back-to-back titles.

Meanwhile, Pat Cummins’ absence as captain and pace spearhead is compounded by Josh Inglis’ unavailability for the San Francisco Unicorns. However, the Unicorns hold onto explosive openers Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, and Finn Allen, while Haris Rauf remains their sole Pakistani retention for the team.

However, these are not the only teams that are affected by star shifts. Franchises like Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas also might lose some star firepower ahead of the draft which can hamper their upcoming campaign.

Cummins And Head's MLC Stats

Pat Cummins had a challenging campaign in the Major League Cricket (MLC), representing the San Francisco Unicorns. The Australian pacer played six matches, delivering 138 balls and conceding 211 runs while picking up four wickets. His best bowling figures in the tournament were 2/35, with a bowling average of 52.75.
summary:
* Australian players Pat Cummins and Travis Head will not participate in the 2025 MLC season due to national commitments, specifically Australia's tour of West Indies in late June.
* Their absence will lead to a reshuffle of franchises, with some retaining core players and releasing others ahead of the upcoming draft.
* The defending champions, Washington Freedom, have retained key players Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, and Jack Edwards, but parted ways with Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye.
* The San Francisco Unicorns, who will miss Pat Cummins as captain and pace spearhead, have retained explosive openers Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short, and Finn Allen, as well as Haris Rauf as their sole Pakistani retention.
* Other franchises, such as the Los Angeles Knight Riders and Seattle Orcas, may also lose star players ahead of the draft, which could impact their campaigns.
* In the previous MLC season, Pat Cummins had a challenging campaign, playing six matches and taking four wickets with a bowling average of 52.75.

title: MLC 2025: Steve Smith & Heinrich Klaasen retained but Travis Head & Mitchell Santner released
body:
Australia batter Steve Smith and South Africa's Heinrich Klaasen are among the overseas stars to be retained for the 2025 Major League Cricket tournament.

The pair have been retained by champions Washington Freedom and Seattle Ocras respectively.

Australia's Glenn Maxwell, South Africa's Marco Jansen and New Zealand's Rachin Ravindra will also stay at Freedom while Los Angeles Knight Riders have kept West Indies duo Andre Russell and Sunil Narine.

Four of the six sides have confirmed their retentions so far with MI Cape Town - who had the likes of Afghanistan's Rashid Khan and West Indies' Nicholas Pooran on their roster - and San Francisco Unicorns - who had Australia skipper Pat Cummins in their squad - yet to announce their retentions.

Number one-ranked T20 batter Travis Head (Freedom), Jason Roy, David Miller, Josh Little (all Knight Riders), Quinton de Kock (Ocras), Aiden Markram and Mitchell Santner (both Super Kings) are among the players to be released.

Overseas players retained for Major League Cricket 2025

Los Angeles Knight Riders: Andre Russell, Sunil Narine and Spencer Johnson

MI New York: Yet to be confirmed

San Francisco Unicorns: Yet to be confirmed

Seattle Ocras: Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton

Texas Super Kings: Faf du Plessis, Noor Ahmad, Devon Conway and Marcus Stoinis
summary: The 2025 Major League Cricket tournament has seen several overseas stars retained by their respective teams. Champions Washington Freedom have retained Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Marco Jansen, and Rachin Ravindra. Seattle Ocras have retained Heinrich Klaasen, while Los Angeles Knight Riders have kept Andre Russell and Sunil Narine. Texas Super Kings have retained Faf du Plessis, Noor Ahmad, Devon Conway, and Marcus Stoinis. Notable players released include Travis Head, Jason Roy, David Miller, and Quinton de Kock. MI New York and San Francisco Unicorns are yet to announce their retentions.

title: Haris Rauf among players retained ahead of MLC 2025 player draft
body:
Pakistan’s right-arm pacer Haris Rauf has been retained by last edition’s runners-up San Francisco Unicorns ahead of the Major League Cricket (MLC) 2025 player draft, scheduled to be held on February 19.

Rauf, who picked up just four wickets at a dismal average of 73.50 in nine matches for the Unicorns in the previous edition, was among the 12 players retained by the franchise.

Unicorns retained the majority of their core but let go of key players including Australia’s Pat Cummins and Josh Inglis and New Zealand’s Matt Henry.

Defending champions Washington Freedom retained 15 players, the most across the six participating teams, but parted ways with hard-hitting Australian opener Travis Head, the joint-highest run-scorer last year, alongside compatriot and captain Steve Smith.

The Freedom also released West Indies’ Akeal Hossein and Australia’s Andrew Tye.

Meanwhile, Seattle Orcas, who finished last in the previous edition after managing to secure just one victory from their seven league-stage matches will undergo a massive squad revamp as they retained the least number of players.

Orcas released a total of seven overseas players including Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, and Obed McCoy.

List of players retained for MLC 2025

LA Knight Riders: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine.

MI New York: Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult.

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short.

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton.

Texas Super Kings: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis.
summary:
**Player Draft**: The MLC 2025 player draft is scheduled to be held on February 19.

**Team Retentions**: Ahead of the draft, teams have retained some of their players from the previous edition. The teams and their retained players are:

* San Francisco Unicorns: 12 players, including Haris Rauf
* Washington Freedom: 15 players, letting go of Travis Head, Steve Smith, Akeal Hossein, and Andrew Tye
* LA Knight Riders: 10 players
* MI New York: 10 players
* Seattle Orcas: 6 players, releasing 7 overseas players including Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, and Obed McCoy
* Texas Super Kings: 10 players

**Notable Releases**: Some notable players released by their teams include Pat Cummins, Josh Inglis, Matt Henry, Travis Head, Steve Smith, and Quinton de Kock.

title: MLC 2025 Released Players List: Pat Cummins & Travis Head to Skip Season With Several Big Names Let go
body:
oi-Mark Hoover

Several star players, including Australia's Travis Head and Pat Cummins were let go as Major League Cricket (MLC) franchises announced their retained and released players ahead of the third season's draft, which is set to take place on February 19.

Cummins and Head have opted to give the season a miss as per a report in CricBuzz due to national team commitments with Australia shceduled to face West Indies in Tests during the MLC 2025 window. Apart from Cummins and Head, South Africa's Kagiso Rabada and David Miller, were also among big names not retained.

Defending champions Washington Freedom, who let go of their joint-highest run-scorer Head, have also let go of bowlers Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye, from their set of international stars from their title-winning squad.

San Francisco Unicorns let go of New Zealand pacer Matt Henry, and Australian wicketkeeper Josh Inglis (157 runs in nine matches) alongside Cummins (4 wickets). The franchise also released West Indies all-rounder Sherfane Rutherford and Pakistan spinner Abrar Ahmed.

MLC 2025 Retentions: Stoinis to Maxwell - List of International Retained Players Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft

Seattle Orcas has released big names like - South African wicketkeeper-batter Quinton de Kock (170 runs in seven games), New Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell, West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, and South African pacer Nandre Burger (four wickets last season).

Meanwhile, South Africa batter Miller (81 runs in six games), England opener Jason Roy (163 runs in six matches), Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan (60 runs, one wicket in four games), and Australian spinner Adam Zampa were released by Los Angeles Knight Riders.

MI New York, the inaugural champions, released South Africa pacer Anrich Nortje (one wicket in two matches), his compatriot Rabada, and power-hitters Tim David (27 runs in three matches) of Australia and Dewald Brevis (85 runs in four matches) of South Africa.

Texas Super Kings (TSK) released the likes of Mitchell Santner (two wickets in two matches) of New Zealand, Matheesha Pathirana of Sri Lanka, Daryl Mitchell of New Zealand, and Naveen-ul-Haq of Afghanistan.

MLC Retentions 2025: Netravalkar to Unmukt Chand – List of Domestic Players Retained Ahead of Major League Cricket Draft

Several notable domestic U.S. players were also not retained, including Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom). Here is a look at the international players being released ahead of MLC 2025 draft:

MLC 2025 Released Players List - International Players Let Go by Major League Cricket teams

MI New York: Kagiso Rabada (South Africa), Anrich Nortje (South Africa), Dewald Brevis (South Africa), Tim David (Australia)

Los Angeles Knight Riders: David Miller (South Africa), Jason Roy (England), Shakib Al Hasan (Bangladesh), Adam Zampa (Australia), Waqar Salamkheil (Afghanistan), Alex Carey (Australia)

Texas Super Kings: Daryl Mitchell (New Zealand), Mitchell Santner (New Zealand), Matheesha Pathirana (Sri Lanka), Naveen-ul-Haq (Afghanistan)

Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock (South Africa), Obed McCoy (West Indies), Michael Bracewell (New Zealand), Nandre Burger (South Africa)

San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins (Australia), Sherfane Rutherford (West Indies), Abrar Ahmed (Pakistan), Matt Henry (New Zealand), Josh Inglis (Australia)

Washington Freedom: Travis Head (Australia), Andrew Tye (Australia), Akeal Hosein (West Indies)
summary:
**Retained and Released Players Ahead of MLC 2025 Draft**

Several top players, including Australia's Travis Head and Pat Cummins, have been released by their respective franchises ahead of the MLC 2025 draft, scheduled for February 19. Cummins and Head will miss the season due to national team commitments with Australia. Other big names released include South Africa's Kagiso Rabada and David Miller.

**Teams and Released Players**

* Washington Freedom: Travis Head, Akeal Hosein, Andrew Tye
* San Francisco Unicorns: Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, Sherfane Rutherford, Abrar Ahmed, Josh Inglis
* Seattle Orcas: Quinton de Kock, Obed McCoy, Michael Bracewell, Nandre Burger
* Los Angeles Knight Riders: David Miller, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, Adam Zampa
* MI New York: Kagiso Rabada, Anrich Nortje, Dewald Brevis, Tim David
* Texas Super Kings: Daryl Mitchell, Mitchell Santner, Matheesha Pathirana, Naveen-ul-Haq

The teams have also released several notable domestic U.S. players, including Steven Taylor, Shehan Jayasuriya, and Jasdeep Singh.

title: MLC 2025 Draft: Top Australia, South Africa Stars Not Retained By Franchises
body:
Travis Head, Steven Smith, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada and David Miller were the big names missing from the retention lists, which the franchises named ahead of the Major League Cricket (MLC) draft scheduled for February 19.

Washington Freedom, who won the last season, retained as many as 15 players. However, the franchise released Head, Smith, Akeal Hosein, and Andrew Tye. Meanwhile, San Francisco Unicorns, who came second, also retained most of their core, including the out of rhythm Jake Fraser-McGurk and Fin Allen. They left out Cummins, Matt Henry and Josh Inglis.

The Seattle Orcas followed a different strategy and retained just seven players, leaving out the likes of Quinton de Kock and Michael Bracewell, among others. They retained only two overseas batters — Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickleton.

The inaugural edition winner, MI New York, retained Keiron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan.

The LA Knight Riders, meanwhile, released Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, Jason Roy and Adam Zampa.

MI Retention list:

San Francisco Unicorns: Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short

Seattle Orcas: Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton

Texas Super Kings: Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis
summary:
**Retention Lists:** The six franchises in the MLC have announced their retention lists ahead of the draft scheduled for February 19. Notable players missing from the lists include Travis Head, Steven Smith, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller.

**Franchise-wise Retention:**

* Washington Freedom retained 15 players, releasing Travis Head, Steven Smith, Akeal Hosein, and Andrew Tye.
* San Francisco Unicorns retained most of their core, including Jake Fraser-McGurk and Fin Allen, but released Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis.
* Seattle Orcas retained only seven players, releasing Quinton de Kock and Michael Bracewell, among others.
* MI New York retained Keiron Pollard, Trent Boult, Nicholas Pooran, and Rashid Khan.
* LA Knight Riders released David Miller, Shakib Al Hasan, Jason Roy, and Adam Zampa.
* Texas Super Kings retained a mix of local and international players, including Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, and Marcus Stoinis.

The retention lists provide insight into each franchise's strategy ahead of the draft, with some teams opting to retain a larger core of players while others have released more players to rebuild their squads.

title: Major League Cricket (MLC) 2025: Complete list of players retained and released ahead of the draft
body:
Major League Cricket (MLC) franchises have announced their retained and released player lists ahead of the 2025 draft, scheduled on February 19. The six teams have made strategic roster adjustments, leading to several high-profile international players entering the player pool.

Defending champions Washington Freedom retained 15 players—the highest among all teams—but opted to release Travis Head, who was their joint-highest run-scorer last season.

Among the notable domestic players not retained are MI New York’s Steven Taylor, Seattle Orcas’ Shehan Jayasuriya and Washington Freedom’s Jasdeep Singh.

MLC 2025: Retained and released players

LA Knight Riders (LAKR)

Retained players: Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine

Released players: David Miller, Jason Roy, Shakib Al Hasan, Adam Zampa, Alex Carey, Derone Davis, Josh Little, Waqar Salamkheil

Washington Freedom (WAF)

summary: The six MLC teams have announced their retained and released players ahead of the 2025 draft, scheduled for February 19. Defending champions Washington Freedom have retained 15 players, the most among all teams, but surprisingly released Travis Head, their joint-highest run-scorer last season. Other notable players not retained by their teams include Steven Taylor (MI New York), Shehan Jayasuriya (Seattle Orcas), and Jasdeep Singh (Washington Freedom). The teams have made strategic roster adjustments, making several high-profile international players available for the upcoming draft.

title: Eight San Francisco Unicorns Domestic Players Return For MLC 2025
body:
San Francisco Unicorns, the Bay Area’s Major League Cricket T20 franchise, has announced its domestic player retentions ahead of the 2025 tournament, with former USA captain Corey Anderson, former England international Liam Plunkett, and breakout players Sanjay Krishnamurthi and Hassan Khan among the eight to continue on the roster.

Under the coaching leadership of Shane Watson, the Unicorns have endeavored to retain the majority of the playing core that led the franchise to the MLC final last year, with an established mix of proven experience and dynamic youth in both the batting and bowling departments.

Unicorns’ captain Corey Anderson has been retained, providing the leadership and all-rounder abilities that have underpinned much of the team’s success over the past two seasons. He will be assisted by World Cup winner Liam Plunkett, pacemen Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, and Juanoy Drysdale, as well as spinner Karima Gore.

Hassan Khan, winner of MLC 2024’s Bart King Award for best domestic player, will also continue on the Unicorns’ books, providing both proven power-hitting and wicket-taking ability, as well as Sanjay Krishnamurthi, one of the team’s standout batters from the last campaign.

Shane Watson, Head Coach of the San Francisco Unicorns, said: “Building a successful cricket franchise for the long run requires both consistency in personnel and quality on the pitch, and we’re pleased that we’ve secured some of the best domestic players and emerging talents in the USA to help us to glory this year.

“The likes of Hassan Khan and Sanjay Krishnamurthi were amongst the top performers league-wide last year, and having seen the whole group develop over the winter, we know they’ll have a lot more to offer this time around under the very capable, committed leadership of Corey [Anderson] and Liam [Plunkett] whose presence around the locker room shouldn’t be underestimated.”

San Francisco Unicorns will look to kick on from 2024 and go one step further to land the MLC 2025 trophy, and with one of the league’s most consistent domestic rosters returning with more experience for this year’s edition, another successful campaign is on the cards.
summary:
**Team:** San Francisco Unicorns, a T20 franchise in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament.
**Retained Players:** 8 domestic players, including:
	* Corey Anderson (former USA captain and all-rounder)
	* Liam Plunkett (former England international)
	* Sanjay Krishnamurthi (standout batter)
	* Hassan Khan (winner of the Bart King Award for best domestic player in MLC 2024)
	* Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Juanoy Drysdale, and Karima Gore
**Coaching Staff:** Shane Watson, Head Coach
**Goal:** To win the MLC 2025 trophy, building on last year's success when the team reached the final.
**Confidence:** The team is confident of doing well this year, given the consistency in personnel, experience, and quality on the pitch.

title: Will IPL teams gaining ownership in The Hundred affect Pakistan players?
body:
The IPL has already spread to various regions, from Major League Cricket in the USA to SA20 teams in South Africa. Currently, four of the eight teams in England's renowned league, The Hundred, are co-owned by franchises that also control IPL teams, meaning that half of the teams will have Indian co-owners. Furthermore, GMR now has complete control over The Hundred team after purchasing a 100% share in Southern Brave.

Advertisment

In the midst of all of this, everyone is wondering if IPL-owned clubs will avoid selecting Pakistani players. This is mostly caused by several factors. While Major League Cricket does feature Pakistani players, only on teams that are not owned by IPL franchises, the SA20 league typically runs concurrently with the PSL.

The ECB does not anticipate that the BCCI's policy of excluding active Indian male players from participating in overseas T20 competitions will be impacted by the inclusion of investors with ties to the Indian Premier League, even though it may open doors to the lucrative Indian market. No Indian player has played in the Hundred, even though they are often involved in county cricket. "We're aware of that in other regions, but that won't be happening here,” Gould was quoted as saying by ESPN Cricinfo about Pakistani players being banned in The Hundred.

Gould promised that Pakistani cricket players will not be constrained

ECB Chief Executive Richard Gould made it clear that the ECB's preparations did not take into account the availability of Indian players. In addition, Gould promised that Pakistani cricket players will not be constrained by IPL influence in the Hundred. He acknowledged that, unlike the Hundred, which depends on Pakistani talent, Pakistan is not represented in IPL-related tournaments such as the ILT20 and MLC.
summary:
* Major League Cricket (MLC) in the USA is one of the regions where the IPL has spread its influence.
* MLC does feature Pakistani players, but only on teams that are not owned by IPL franchises.
* There is no indication that IPL-owned clubs will avoid selecting Pakistani players in the MLC.

Note: The article does not provide any additional information about the MLC tournament, such as its schedule, teams, or other details. It only mentions MLC as one of the regions where IPL has expanded and its relation to Pakistani players.

title: Travis Head, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller Not Retained for MLC 2025
body:
Six Major League Cricket Major League Cricket franchises named their retentions ahead of the draft for the upcoming season on February 19. Coming to to top two teams from last year, defending champions Washington Freedom retained 15 players, which makes them the team with the most number of retained players. While doing so, they have shockingly let go of the joint-highest scorer from last year, Travis Head and even their captain, Steven Smith.

They have retained two overseas players in the form of Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye. Speaking of the runners-up from last season, San Francisco Unicorns have not retained Pat Cummins, Matt Henry and Josh Inglis. But, they have managed to retain the fiery opening pair of Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk. On the other hand, the least number of retentions came at the end of Seattle Orcas.

Orcas have retained just two overseas players in the form of Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton. They have retained just seven players and released as many overseas players as Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, Obed McCoy and Nandre Burger. Along with Head and Cummins, other notable players who have missed the draft are Kagiso Rabada and David Miller.

Also Read: The Hundred Men: MCC to discuss changes for London Spirit franchise for 2026 season

List of players retained for MLC 2025

LA Knight Riders:

Ali Khan, Adithya Ganesh, Unmukt Chand, Nitish Kumar, Corne Dry, Saif Badar, Shadley van Schalkwyk, Matthew Tromp, Spencer Johnson, Andre Russell, Sunil Narine.

MI New York:

Ehsan Adil, Nosthush Kenjige, Monank Patel, Heath Richards, Rushil Ugarkar, Sunny Patel, Kieron Pollard, Nicholas Pooran, Rashid Khan, Trent Boult.

San Francisco Unicorns:

Corey Anderson, Hassan Khan, Liam Plunkett, Carmi Le Roux, Brody Couch, Karima Gore, Juanoy Drysdale, Sanjay Krishnamurthi, Haris Rauf, Finn Allen, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Matthew Short.

Also Read: SA20 2025: Five MI Cape Town players named in Team of Tournament

Seattle Orcas:

Harmeet Singh, Cameron Gannon, Ali Sheikh, Ayan Desai, Aaron Jones, Heinrich Klaasen, Ryan Rickelton.

Texas Super Kings:

Joshua Tromp, Calvin Savage, Milind Kumar, Mohammad Mohsin, Zia-ul-Haq, Saiteja Mukkamalla, Faf du Plessis, Devon Conway, Noor Ahmad, Marcus Stoinis.

Washington Freedom:

Andries Gous, Mukhtar Ahmed, Obus Pienaar, Saurabh Netravalkar, Ian Holland, Amila Aponso, Justin Dill, Lahiru Milantha, Yasir Mohammad, Marco Jansen, Glenn Maxwell, Lockie Ferguson, Rachin Ravindra, Steven Smith, Jack Edwards.

Disclaimer: The information presented in this news article is based on the author’s insights, analysis, and perspective. Readers are encouraged to evaluate the details thoughtfully and draw their own conclusions.
summary:
**Retention Updates**

Six MLC franchises have announced their retained players ahead of the draft on February 19. The teams with the most retained players are:

* Washington Freedom (15 players): defending champions who have retained two overseas players, Akeal Hosein and Andrew Tye, but shockingly let go of Travis Head and captain Steven Smith.
* San Francisco Unicorns (11 players): runners-up who have retained the opening pair of Finn Allen and Jake Fraser-McGurk, but released Pat Cummins, Matt Henry, and Josh Inglis.
* Seattle Orcas (7 players): have retained only two overseas players, Heinrich Klaasen and Ryan Rickelton, and released several notable players including Quinton de Kock, Michael Bracewell, Obed McCoy, and Nandre Burger.

**Notable Players Released**

* Travis Head, Pat Cummins, Kagiso Rabada, and David Miller are among the notable players who will go into the draft.

**Full List of Retained Players**

The article includes the full list of retained players for each of the six MLC franchises: LA Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.
